channel.title: My brother's new 360 Slim is freezing
channel.description:
My brother got a new 360 slim for Christmas today. I transferred over his stuff via USB and he played the shit out of it for a good hour or so. Then my cousins came over and we continued to play the shot out of it. After a few hours, though, it started to freeze. Now it won't play for more than twenty minutes.
Is it possible the son of a bitch overheated on the first day? We have it placed horizontally on a glass shelf, with plenty of space above and next to it. I did place my hand on it and felt it was borderline hot, but I guess that means the fan is working and blowing the hot air out.
Any ideas? Laser error? Just a faulty model? Will another model actually work?

item.title: My brother's new 360 Slim is freezing
item.dc:creator: Mith
item.description:
the company that manufactures them is too fucking stupid to actually make sure that their product is built to last.

i’d say it’s a pretty smart business strategy to make them break so often if the kids are gonna keep buying brand new ones

the fault lies within the stupidity of the customers, not the company

i’d never re-buy a console, like ever. but hey i’ve never had a newer console since my old saturn (which still works perfectly)

item.description:
Yes I know that the Ps3 is less likely to break, but still its the only console that have broken for me, my NES, PS1, gamecube, wii and 360 (2nd hand) are working like a charm. And i probably had less than 20h of total playtime on the ps3.

But I guess I just had some bad luck.

item.source: My brother's new 360 Slim is freezing

item.title: My brother's new 360 Slim is freezing
item.dc:creator: CTID
item.description:
Well no, he is right. The average Wii gamer is a casual gamer who doesn’t play for extended amounts of time like the average gamer for the PS3 and 360 are. But Microsoft is always in such a rush to put out products that they never actually make sure it’s built well. The original 360 had major reliability issues, as well as this new one. PS3s have failures, but as has been stated, it’s not really a huge thing because like Daedalus stated, electronic hardware WILL fail after a lot of use, but the PS3 is actually built fairly well. The only reason a lot of people use the 360 over the PS3 is its game library, and now the PS3 actually has a pretty awesome library, so now it’s mostly brand loyalty, and they don’t want to shell out $300 for another console. It’s kind of ridiculous, considering the amount of bullshit most 360 owners go through.

I’ve seriously had my friends tell me about the number of 360s they go through, AND THEY STILL USE THEM. It’s fucking retarded that you would go through so much for a console that IS going to fail because the company that manufactures them is too fucking stupid to actually make sure that their product is built to last.

Read full topic

CTID:

The point is the failure rate of the PS3 (and the Wii, ESPECIALLY the Wii), can’t even HOPE to hold a candle to the monumental failure rate of the 360.

The Wii has such a low failure rate because they are used less for shorter periods of time for casual games. (Mostly, anyway)

item.title: My brother's new 360 Slim is freezing
item.dc:creator: Daedalus
item.description:
Debdibib:

PS3 is not always better, mine got busted a few weeks ago. No audio and video, slow fan speed and started to smell burnt no warning ether.

Hope I get it back soon, want to try my AC2.

Yeah, every electronic device can fail. The difference is that the chance that a PS3 will fail is within the normal failure rate of electronic devices. The 360…not so much.

I have a PS1 from 1995, a PS2 (Silver slim), a PSP and a PS3 and non of them have ever failed for me. All of them are still working perfectly.

item.title: My brother's new 360 Slim is freezing
item.dc:creator: Shnazliztur
item.description:
That is why I don’t own a 360 anymore, they are just the crysler sebring of gaming. Unreliable would be an understatement. If you want a “good” console, get a PS3, but if you really like the 360 controller better, buy this magical device called the cross battle adapter by XCM & it works. The sweet feeling of a 360 controller on a PS3 playing Uncharted & Ico is amazing, may include grief & feeling a bit sly, but its epic nonetheless.

Or you could just get a gaming rig like the others mentioned, I just prefer the game pad over the mouse & keyboard for some reason.

Read full topic
